ai-thag11.1:1.1_0: “What good does it do you to be in the grove, my dear?
ai-thag11.1:1.2_0: like a lion’s raining in the rainy season.
ai-thag11.1:1.3_0: The city of Verambhā is nice for you—
ai-thag11.1:1.4_0: for seclusion is the practice of seclusion.”
ai-thag11.1:2.2_0: scatters the clouds as they pour down,
ai-thag11.1:3.1_0: “It’s all black and born of an egg—
ai-thag11.1:3.2_0: the crow that lives in the charnel ground
ai-thag11.1:4.3_0: such a monk sleeps at ease,
ai-thag11.1:5.1_0: The water’s clear and the rocks are broad,
ai-thag11.1:5.2_0: monkeys and deer are all around;
ai-thag11.1:7.2_0: May they be slaughtered! May they suffer!’—
ai-thag11.1:7.3_0: I’m not aware of having any such intentions
ai-thag11.1:8.3_0: The heavy burden is laid down,
ai-thag11.1:8.4_0: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.
ai-thag11.1:9.2_0: from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-thag11.1:11.7_0: The Book of the Elevens is finished.
ai-thag11.1:12.0_0: Then they pass away from that host of gods
ai-thag11.1:12.2_0: they’ve completed the task and are free of defilements.
ai-thag11.1:12.4_0: and one is worshipped in this verse.
